intro: Pedicularis semenowii, commonly known as the Semenow's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color, and its hairy, branched stems. It thrives in rocky or alpine environments, often growing at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
